revised_title: Mitosis Arrest in Roots: The Effects of Oxygen-Lack and Cyanide
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on pea-root tips to study the effects of oxygen-lack and cyanide on mitosis. They discovered that mitosis is arrested in the absence of oxygen or in the presence of cyanide. This finding challenges previous generalizations that mitosis can proceed without oxygen once it has begun. The results suggest that all stages of cell division depend on the presence of oxygen.
